solution: This array shows that 8 x 7 = 56. It has 8 rows with 7 dots in each row.
There are 56 dots in total.
This number line also shows that 8 x 7 = 56. Count by 7s on the number line. Count forward 8 times.
The last arrow ends at 56. So, 8 x 7 = 56.
solution_image_tag: An 8×7 array of yellow dots arranged in a rectangular grid pattern. This visual representation shows 8 rows with 7 dots in each row, totaling 56 dots, which demonstrates the multiplication fact 8 × 7 = 56.

A number line from 0 to 70 with tick marks at multiples of 7 (0, 7, 14, 21, 28, 35, 42, 49, 56, 63, 70). Blue curved arrows show 8 jumps of 7 units each, starting from 0 and ending at 56 (which is highlighted with a blue box). This demonstrates counting by 7s eight times to reach 56.
